item.title: China Plans Around 5% Growth Goal, Higher Deficit, Reuters Says
item.description: Chinese leaders plan to set an annual growth goal of about 5% for next year and raise the budget deficit to 4% of gross domestic product, Reuters reported, citing two people it didn’t identify.

item.title: Fakih: Evidence of Abuse in Syria Must Be Protected
item.description: Syrians have been trying to find loved ones who disappeared during the 13-year civil war under Bashar Al Assad's rule. Human Rights Watch also says a mass grave in Damascus suggests that the area may have been the site of summary executions. Lama Fakih, MENA Director at HRW told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa host Joumanna Bercetche that the evidence of abuse has been staggering & must be preserved to hold the perpetrators accountable. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bubble Tea Makers Revive IPO Ambitions With China Said to Be Softening Stance
item.description: China’s bubble-tea makers are reviving plans for initial public offerings, encouraged by signs that Beijing is loosening its grip on the market and sentiment is improving after a disappointing debut by one of the industry’s biggest chains earlier this year.
item.dc:creator: Julia Fioretti, Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: A matcha tea inside a Chabaidao bubble tea store, operated by Sichuan Baicha Baidao Industrial Co., in Shanghai, China, on Tuesday, April 23, 2024. Chinese bubble-tea maker Chabaidao plunged more than 38% in its trading debut in Hong Kong, the latest setback for the city as it attempts to revive its moribund financial markets.

item.title: Australia Faces Calls to Tackle Antisemitism Efficiently
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the nation should stand together against antisemitism, after a series of incidents against the Jewish community. The federal government has set up a police task force in the wake of an arson attack on a synagogue in Melbourne that has been labelled a terrorist incident. Robert Menzies Institute CEO Georgina Downer says Australia has become a "dangerous place" for the Jewish community and Albanese needs to take a hardline stance on the issue. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: New Zealand Faces Wider Budget Deficits, Later Surplus
item.description: New Zealand’s government is facing deeper budget deficits and a delayed return to surplus as a prolonged economic downturn and poor productivity hit tax revenue.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Withers

media:content.media:description: WELLINGTON, NEW ZEALAND - NOVEMBER 27: Minister of Finance Nicola Willis speaks during a press conference at Parliament on November 27, 2024 in Wellington, New Zealand. Since the election, New Zealand's new National Government and Finance Minister have implemented significant economic reforms aimed at addressing the country's rising cost of living and inflation. Key measures include tax cuts for low and middle-income earners, a focus on reducing government spending, and a commitment to maintaining fiscal responsibility, designed to stimulate economic growth while alleviating financial pressures on households, with critics saying that uncosted policies might be detrimental to the economy. (Photo by Hagen Hopkins/Getty Images) Photographer: Hagen Hopkins/Getty Images AsiaPac

item.title: Australian Pensions Weak on Private Markets Oversight, APRA Says
